references.paper_title: Learning Language-Conditioned Robot Behavior from Offline Data and Crowd-Sourced Annotation
references.reason: This paper is foundational for the LLM-based skill diffusion approach, demonstrating the use of language-conditioned robot behavior learned from offline data and crowdsourced annotation.

references.paper_title: LISA: Learning Interpretable Skill Abstractions from Language
references.reason: This paper introduces LISA, a hierarchical skill learning method that uses language to learn interpretable skill abstractions, which is highly relevant to the hierarchical skill learning structure in LDuS.

references.paper_title: Language Control Diffusion: Efficiently Scaling through Space, Time, and Tasks
references.reason: This paper is important because it adapts diffusion models for language-conditioned policy, which is a key component of the LDuS framework.

references.paper_title: Loss-Guided Diffusion Models for Plug-and-Play Controllable Generation
references.reason: This paper introduces the loss-guided diffusion mechanism, which is the core technique used in LDuS for controlled trajectory generation.

references.paper_title: Language-Guided Traffic Simulation via Scene-Level Diffusion
references.reason: This paper demonstrates the use of LLMs to guide the generation process of diffusion models, which is highly relevant to the LLM-guided diffusion aspect of LDuS.
